name: HTTPS Thumbnails
author: Marty Kokes

sections.description: A simple plugin that sets the protocol of a thumbnails source to match the protocol that is currently being used to display a page. This is helpful if you’ve recently implemented https on your site and your browser is telling you that the page contains items that have been delivered insecurely.
sections.installation: Just activate the plugin and you’re good to go.
sections.faq:
Does this plugin affect non-SSL traffic?

Yes. If a page is being displayed with http it’ll also correct thumbnail urls that start with https and set them to http

short_description: Corrects http image links on a page delivered over https.
